questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. The Business Transformation Readiness Assessment technique is primarily focused on ___

choices.C: ensuring that there are adequate trained developers and engineers to implement the solution
choices.D: ensuring that there is sufficient financial capacity to execute the desired transformation
choices.A: determining if the organization is ready to accept change
choices.B: planning the migration steps needed to achieve the transformation
choices.E: determining if there is adequate stakeholder support for the implementation process

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. determining if the organization is ready to accept change

Selected Answer: A
Business Transformation Readiness Assessment, used for evaluating and quantifying an organizationâ€™s readiness to undergo change.

questions.question_text: Which of the following statements does NOT correctly describe Architecture Principles?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
4.2.4 Architecture Principles
Purpose
Principles are general rules and guidelines, intended to be enduring and seldom amended, that inform and support the way in which an organization sets about fulfilling its mission.

In their turn, principles may be just one element in a structured set of ideas that collectively define and guide the organization, from values through to actions and results.
Architecture Principles are general rules and guidelines. They are not policies, hence C is correct.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct

choices.B: They are based on enterprise principles
choices.C: They are detailed policies that prescribe behaviors and requirements
choices.A: They are most effective when they are embraced and used across the organization
choices.D: Even though they may appear generic, they should be tailored to reflect an organization's culture and goals

discussion.content:
Architecture Principles has:
Name, Statement, Rationale, Implications.

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. All of the following are sections of the recommended template for defining Architecture Principles, except ___________

choices.B: Comprehensive, Future proof, Short, Concise, Consistent

discussion.content:
D is correct.
Qualities are: Understandable, Robust, Complete, Consistent, Stable

questions.question_text: Which one of the following lists the five quality criteria for defining Architecture Principles?

choices.E: determine the required service levels for the architecture
choices.D: identify commercial building blocks to be purchased
choices.B: identify potential missing or overlapping functions
choices.A: establish quality parameters for the architecture

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Answer B

A key step in validating an architecture is to consider what may have been forgotten. The architecture must support all of the essential information processing needs of the organization. The most critical source of gaps that should be considered is stakeholder concerns that have not been addressed in prior architectural work.

Source: https://pubs.opengroup.org/architecture/togaf9-doc/arch/chap23.html

Selected Answer: B
Option b is gap analysis

Selected Answer: D
Based on "The basic premise is to highlight a shortfall between the Baseline Architecture and the Target Architecture; that is, items that have been deliberately omitted, accidentally left out, or not yet defined." --> There is no mention of "overlapping".

And thus by means of above definition, "identifying missing component, that may need procurement" sound plausible.

Answer - B.

The technique known as gap analysis is widely used in the TOGAF Architecture Development Method (ADM) to validate an architecture that is being developed. The basic premise is to highlight a shortfall between the Baseline Architecture and the Target Architecture; that is, items that have been deliberately omitted, accidentally left out, or not yet defined.

A key step in validating an architecture is to consider what may have been forgotten. The
architecture must support all of the essential information processing needs of the organization. The most critical source of gaps that should be considered is stakeholder concerns that have not been addressed in prior architectural work.

questions.question_text: Complete the sentence. The key purpose of Gap Analysis is to _____
